Quick search

Calculate Feature Generators¶

Functions¶

xr_fresh.extractors.extract_features(xr_data, feature_dict, band, na_rm=False, dim='variable', *args)[source]¶

Extract features from

  • a xarray.DataArray containing a time series of rasters

A xarray.DataArray with the calculated features will be returned a ‘variable’.

Examples

>>>  f_dict = { 'maximum':[{}] ,
               'quantile': [{'q':"0.5"},{'q':'0.95'}]}
>>>  features = extract_features(xr_data=ds,
>>>                     feature_dict=f_dict,
>>>                     band='aet',
>>>                     na_rm = True)
Parameters

  • xr_data (xarray.DataArray) – The xarray.DataArray with a time series of rasters to compute the features for.

  • feature_dict (dict) – mapping from feature calculator names to parameters. Only those names which are keys in this dict will be calculated. See example above.

  • band (str) – The name of the variable to create feature for.

  • na_rm (bool) – If True (default), all missing values are masked using .attrs[‘nodatavals’]

  • dim (str) – The name of the dimension used to collect outputed features

Returns

The DataArray containing extracted features in dim.

Return type

xarray.DataArray
